intro: Anthriscus sosnovskyi, commonly known as Siberian cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and small white flowers that bloom in umbels. It thrives in rocky and alpine environments, often growing at high altitudes. Due to its ornamental value and hardiness, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens with well-drained soil.
